lines.transliteration_english: Sree Gur Daras Dhiaan Sree Gur Sabada , Giaan Sasatr Sanaah Panch Doot Basi Aaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Contemplating on the vision of the True Guru and practicing His impressed divine word are the weapons for fighting the five evils like lust, anger, avarice etc.

lines.gurmukhi: sRI gur crn ryn sRI gur srin Dyn krm Brm kit ABY pd pwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sree Gur Charan Rayn Sree Gur Sarani Dhayna , Karam Bharam Kati Abhai Pad Paaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The refuge of True Guru and by living in the dust of His feet, the ill effects and doubts of all past performed deeds are vanquished. One acquires a state of fearlessness.

lines.gurmukhi: sRI gur bcn lyK sRI gur syvk ByK ACl AlyK pRBu AlK lKwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sree Gur Bachan Laykh Sree Gur Sayvak Bhaykha , Achhal Alaykh Prabhu Alakh Lakhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By imbibing the divine words of Satguru (True Guru), and by developing an attitude of a true slave, one realises the imperceptible, indeceivable and indescribable Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK swDsMg gosit pRym pRsMg inMmRqw inrMqrI kY shj smwey hY ]135]
lines.transliteration_english: Gursikh Saadhasang Gosati Praym Prasanga , Ninmrataa Nirantaree Kai Sahaj Samaaay Hai ?135?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the company of holy men of the True Guru, singing Gurbani (Guru's utterances in praise of the Lord) with humility and love, one gets absorbed in the spiritual peace. (135)
